verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329>Musician<s%>, A <S%H4210>Psalm<s%> of <S%H1732>David<s%>. In thee, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, do I put my <S%H2620>trust<s%>; let me <S%H408>never<s%> <S%H5769><s%> be <S%H954>ashamed<s%>: <S%H6403>deliver<s%> me in thy <S%H6666>righteousness<s%>.

Bow <S%H5186>down<s%> thine <S%H241>ear<s%> to me; <S%H5337>deliver<s%> me <S%H4120>speedily<s%>: be thou my <S%H4581>strong<s%> <S%H6697>rock<s%>, for an <S%H1004>house<s%> of <S%H4686>defence<s%> to <S%H3467>save<s%> me. my: Heb. to me for a rock of strength
For thou art my <S%H5553>rock<s%> and my <S%H4686>fortress<s%>; therefore for thy <S%H8034>name's<s%> sake <S%H5148>lead<s%> me, and <S%H5095>guide<s%> me.
Pull me <S%H3318>out<s%> of the <S%H7568>net<s%> <S%H2098>that<s%> they have laid <S%H2934>privily<s%> for me: for thou art my <S%H4581>strength<s%>.
Into thine <S%H3027>hand<s%> I <S%H6485>commit<s%> my <S%H7307>spirit<s%>: thou hast <S%H6299>redeemed<s%> me, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H410>God<s%> of <S%H571>truth<s%>.
I have <S%H8130>hated<s%> them that <S%H8104>regard<s%> <S%H7723>lying<s%> <S%H1892>vanities<s%>: but I <S%H982>trust<s%> in the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.

I will be <S%H1523>glad<s%> and <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> in thy <S%H2617>mercy<s%>: for thou hast <S%H7200>considered<s%> my <S%H6040>trouble<s%>; thou hast <S%H3045>known<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> in <S%H6869>adversities<s%>;
And hast not shut me <S%H5462>up<s%> into the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of the <S%H341>enemy<s%>: thou hast <S%H5975>set<s%> my <S%H7272>feet<s%> in a large <S%H4800>room<s%>.

Have <S%H2603>mercy<s%> upon me, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, for I am in <S%H6887>trouble<s%>: mine <S%H5869>eye<s%> is <S%H6244>consumed<s%> with <S%H3708>grief<s%>, yea, my <S%H5315>soul<s%> and my <S%H990>belly<s%>.

For my <S%H2416>life<s%> is <S%H3615>spent<s%> with <S%H3015>grief<s%>, and my <S%H8141>years<s%> with <S%H585>sighing<s%>: my <S%H3581>strength<s%> <S%H3782>faileth<s%> because of mine <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>, and my <S%H6106>bones<s%> are <S%H6244>consumed<s%>.

I was a <S%H2781>reproach<s%> among all mine <S%H6887>enemies<s%>, but <S%H3966>especially<s%> among my <S%H7934>neighbours<s%>, and a <S%H6343>fear<s%> to mine <S%H3045>acquaintance<s%>: they that did <S%H7200>see<s%> me <S%H2351>without<s%> <S%H5074>fled<s%> from me.
I am <S%H7911>forgotten<s%> as a dead <S%H4191>man<s%> out of <S%H3820>mind<s%>: I am like a <S%H6>broken<s%> <S%H3627>vessel<s%>. a broken: Heb. a vessel that perisheth

For I have <S%H8085>heard<s%> the <S%H1681>slander<s%> of <S%H7227>many<s%>: <S%H4032>fear<s%> was on every <S%H5439>side<s%>: while they took <S%H3245>counsel<s%> <S%H3162>together<s%> against me, they <S%H2161>devised<s%> to take <S%H3947>away<s%> my <S%H5315>life<s%>.
But I <S%H982>trusted<s%> in thee, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>: I <S%H559>said<s%>, Thou art my <S%H430>God<s%>.
My <S%H6256>times<s%> are in thy <S%H3027>hand<s%>: <S%H5337>deliver<s%> me from the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of mine <S%H341>enemies<s%>, and from them that <S%H7291>persecute<s%> me.
Make thy <S%H6440>face<s%> to <S%H215>shine<s%> upon thy <S%H5650>servant<s%>: <S%H3467>save<s%> me for thy <S%H2617>mercies'<s%> sake.

Let me not be <S%H954>ashamed<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>; for I have <S%H7121>called<s%> upon thee: let the <S%H7563>wicked<s%> be <S%H954>ashamed<s%>, and let them be <S%H1826>silent<s%> in the <S%H7585>grave<s%>. silent: or, cut off for

Let the <S%H8267>lying<s%> <S%H8193>lips<s%> be put to <S%H481>silence<s%>; which <S%H1696>speak<s%> <S%H6277>grievous<s%> things <S%H1346>proudly<s%> and <S%H937>contemptuously<s%> against the <S%H6662>righteous<s%>. grievous: Heb. a hard thing

Oh how <S%H7227>great<s%> is thy <S%H2898>goodness<s%>, which thou hast laid <S%H6845>up<s%> for them that <S%H3373>fear<s%> thee; which thou hast <S%H6466>wrought<s%> for them that <S%H2620>trust<s%> in thee before the <S%H1121>sons<s%> of <S%H120>men<s%>!

Thou shalt <S%H5641>hide<s%> them in the <S%H5643>secret<s%> of thy <S%H6440>presence<s%> from the <S%H7407>pride<s%> of <S%H376>man<s%>: thou shalt keep them <S%H6845>secretly<s%> in a <S%H5521>pavilion<s%> from the <S%H7379>strife<s%> of <S%H3956>tongues<s%>.
<S%H1288>Blessed<s%> be the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>: for he hath shewed me his <S%H6381>marvellous<s%> <S%H2617>kindness<s%> in a <S%H4692>strong<s%> <S%H5892>city<s%>. strong: or, fenced

For I <S%H559>said<s%> in my <S%H2648>haste<s%>, I am cut <S%H1629>off<s%> from <S%H5048>before<s%> thine <S%H5869>eyes<s%>: <S%H403>nevertheless<s%> thou <S%H8085>heardest<s%> the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of my <S%H8469>supplications<s%> when I <S%H7768>cried<s%> unto thee.

O <S%H157>love<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, all ye his <S%H2623>saints<s%>: for the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H5341>preserveth<s%> the <S%H539>faithful<s%>, and <S%H3499>plentifully<s%> <S%H7999>rewardeth<s%> the <S%H1346>proud<s%> <S%H6213>doer<s%>.
Be of good <S%H2388>courage<s%>, and he shall <S%H553>strengthen<s%> your <S%H3824>heart<s%>, all ye that <S%H3176>hope<s%> in the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
